title: 106_s2821
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000". It addresses the creditability of service. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 amends Section 8411 of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between 1988 and 2000, if later subject to this chapter. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 amends Section 8411 of title 5, United States Code to require employees or Members to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service performed as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between 1988 and 2000. If the deposit is not made within 5 years, interest will be added annually. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 requires employees to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for temporary or intermittent service at the FDIC between 1988 and 2000. If the deposit is not made within 5 years, interest will be added annually. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given if a written application is submitted by December 31, 2001. Any annuity or survivor annuity will be recomputed to include the service performed, effective more than 30 days after the application is submitted. If the required deposit is not made timely, conditions apply. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. An annuity or survivor annuity will be recomputed to include the service performed, effective more than 30 days after the application is submitted. If the required deposit is not made timely, conditions apply for reduction in the recomputed annuity. The Office of Personnel Management will notify individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Corporation will provide information on an individual's service upon request from the Office.
